Key Match Events: Aaron Civale allowed only two hits in his first seven-inning start since last July
William Contreras stole home for the first time in his professional career
Post-Match Reflections: The Brewers have been playing like the team they hope to be in October
At 77-56, the Brewers pulled within one game of the Phillies for the league’s second-best record
They keep posting. They keep competing. It doesn’t always add up, but I love what they’re doing. I love how they’re competing. They’re keeping it in the moment. They’re keeping it pitch to pitch.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Civale and Ashby team up for shutout
Contreras helped the Brewers steal a run with aggressive baserunning
